result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica S VanDaalen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(clerked by SM)
Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM362, 15CM413, 15CM285 & 15CM158

15CM158, 15CM362, 15CM413 - Court dismisses and reads-in.

15CM285 - Court questions Defendant.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 1.  Court accepts and finds guilty.
Argument by State.
Argument by Attorney Raymond.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders:
Impose and stay 60 days jail with huber and huber/homemaker.  Credit for 7 days.  
Probation - 1 year.  Must check in at probation on November 30, 2015 at 3:00 PM.
Continue AODA counseling at Vantage Point Clinic as long as counselor recommends it.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Any other assessments or programming per agent.
Costs

All bond money posted in any case is to be applied to costs per agreement of defendant.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to Defendant.  To report December 1, 2015 between 1 - 5 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must undergo daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.

Bond modified 10-27-15 as follows:  Change time PBT from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM

All other conditions to reamin in full force and effect.

Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell E Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM285 & 15CM413. 
Defense requests the daily PBT condition on both bonds be removed. State relates. Court relates and orders the bonds be modified to change the PBT time from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM.
to Appear signed by Defendant for Public Defender's Office

Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM362, 15CM413, 15CM285 & 15CM158
Authorization filed.  Defendant here earlier today.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must undergo daily PBTs at the Rice Lake Police Department at 6:00 PM.

Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Jessica S VanDaalen in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for Public Defender and will be represented by Ryan Raymond.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond set.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
